message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.SOC, cs.MM

This paper deals with the analysis of user manipulation on social media, specifically Twitter, through the use of automated accounts to artificially propel a chosen keyword to the top of Twitter trending topics. This falls under the category of social and information networks (cs.SI). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of compromised accounts and the deletion of tweets to evade detection, which could fall under the categories of cyber security (cs.CY) and cryptography and security (cs.CR). The paper also touches upon the impact of these attacks on user opinions and the potential for illicit advertisements, which could fall under the categories of social and information networks (cs.SOC) and multimedia (cs.MM).
